message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is characterized by diffuse crackles on auscultation, digit clubbing, and cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan. Cushing’s syndrome is not typically associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Acute exposure to asbestos can cause pulmonary fibrosis but it is not idiopathic. Smoking cessation can slow the progression of the disease but will not reverse the symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms are consistent with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, and among the options, a finding of cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan is expected. Cushing’s syndrome and acute exposure to asbestos are not associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, and while smoking cessation is important for overall health, it is not likely to reverse the symptoms of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a type of interstitial lung disease that involves scarring or fibrosis of the lungs, leading to a progressive decline in lung function. One of the hallmark findings on chest CT scan is the presence of cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium. Cushing’s syndrome is not directly related to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, and acute exposure to asbestos can cause a different type of interstitial lung disease. While smoking cessation is important for overall lung health, it does not reverse the effects of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a chronic and progressive lung disease that causes scarring of the lung tissues, resulting in breathing difficulties. Mild digit clubbing is also expected as a result of chronic hypoxemia. Among the options, only option D is related to the diagnosis, as cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium, also known as honeycombing, are commonly seen on CT scan in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Among the options, only cylindrically-shaped cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan are expected to be seen in this patient. Cushing's syndrome and acute exposure to asbestos are not related to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, while smoking cessation is not expected to reverse the symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis can be caused by many factors, including viral infections, autoimmune disorders, and environmental exposure to toxins. Smoking is a risk factor, but cessation does not reverse the symptoms. Cushing's syndrome and acute exposure to asbestos are not associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. The cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan are a common finding in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) is a chronic, progressive lung disease that involves scarring of the lung tissue. CT scan will show honeycomb changes that indicate cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium. Cushing’s syndrome is not a known association with IPF. Acute exposure to asbestos may cause respiratory symptoms but is not a known cause of IPF. Smoking cessation may slow down the progression of the disease but will not result in a reversal of symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a progressive lung disease that causes scarring of lung tissue. It is associated with a history of smoking and has no known cure. The additional finding that may be expected in this patient is cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan. Cushing’s syndrome is not associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, acute exposure to asbestos causes mesothelioma, and smoking cessation does not reverse symptoms of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a lung disease characterized by progressive interstitial fibrosis and leads to respiratory failure. Among the options, only D is associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis as cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium can be seen on chest CT scans. Cushing’s syndrome is characterized by cortisol excess and Acute exposure to asbestos can lead to pleural effusions or interstitial fibrosis. Reversal of symptoms with smoking cessation is not expected in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis as the disease is irreversible.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis often presents with shortness of breath and dry cough with no known cause. The crackles and digit clubbing are also common in patients with this condition. Among the options, only (D) is expected in this patient since idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis presents with the accumulation of scar tissue in the lungs which causes cystic airspaces in the lung interstitium on CT scan.
